title.narrative: F.a: Capacity Building of National Federations

description.narrative: The objective of the project is to strengthen membership bases of three national confederations and increase their organizational skills, as well as cooperation in Burkina Faso which is one of the world's poorest countries.Burkina Faso's population nearly half of them were living on less than a dollar a day in 2010. In recent years, the mining industry has grown strongly due to the discovery of new ore deposits and Burkina Faso has rapidly emerged as Africa's fourth largest gold producer. The benefits of ec onomic growth are not equally distributed among different population groups, and the political elite and their related parties take a substantial part of the income. In Burkina Faso, the political opposition has been weak for decades and as a result the tr ade union movement has been the most credible representative of civil society and the regime critic. On the other hand the growing and young population creates good opportunities for the trade union movement to grow and to participate in social processes o f change, if they are able to cooperate.During the first phase, the organizing expertise and membership base of three confederations have been increased as well as cooperation strengthened.The project beneficiaries are the organizers of confederations and sectoral trade unions, education officers, as well as representatives of women's and youth committees.The project is implemented by three Burkinabe Confederations: Confederation of Burkina The National Confederation of Workers of Burkina Faso (CNTB), The T rade Union Confederation of Burkina Faso (CSB) and the National Organization of Free Trade Unions (ONSL).
